sect1.title: Lua API
sect1.para: To access the darktable specific functions you must load the darktable environement:
All functions and data are accessed through the darktable module.
This documentation was generated with darktable version 1.4rc1+5~g2cf63dc.

sect2.title: darktable
sect2.para: The darktable library is the main entry point for all access to the darktable internals.

sect3.title: darktable.print
sect3.para: Will print a string to the darktable control log (the long overlayed window that appears over the main panel).

listitem.para: The string to display which should be a single line.

sect3.title: darktable.print_error
sect3.para: This function will print its parameter if the Lua logdomain is activated. Start darktable with the "-d lua" command line option to enable the Lua logdomain.

listitem.para: The string to display.

sect3.title: darktable.register_event
sect3.para: This function registers a callback to be called when a given event happens.
Events are documented in the event section.

listitem.para: The name of the event to register to.
The function to call on event. The signature of the function depends on the type of event.
Some events need extra parameters at registraion time; these must be specified here.

sect3.title: darktable.register_storage
sect3.para: This function will add a new storage implemented in Lua.
A storage is a module that is responsible for handling images once they have been generated during export. Examples of core storages include filesystem, e-mail, facebook...

listitem.para: A Unique name for the plugin.
A human readable name for the plugin.
This function is called once for each exported image. Images can be exported in parallel but the calls to this function will be serialized.
The storage object used for the export.
The exported image object.
The format object used for the export.
The name of a temporary file where the processed image is stored.
The number of the image out of the export series.
The total number of images in the export series.
True if the export is high quality.
An empty Lua table to take extra data. This table is common to all calls to store and the call to finalize in a given export series.
This function is called once all images are processed and all store calls are finished.
The storage object used for the export.
A table keyed by the exported image objects and valued with the corresponding temporary export filename.
An empty Lua table to store extra data. This table is common to all calls to store and the call to finalize in a given export series.
A function called to check if a given image format is supported by the Lua storage; this is used to build the dropdown format list for the GUI.
Nate that the parameters in the format are the ones currently set in the GUI; the user might change them before export.
The storage object tested.
The format object to report about.
True if the corresponding format is supported.

sect3.title: darktable.films
sect3.para: A table containing all the film objects in the database.

sect3.title: darktable.gui
sect3.para: This subtable contains function and data to manipulate the darktable user interface with Lua.
Most of these function won't do anything if the GUI is not enabled (i.e you are using the command line version darktabl-cli instead of darktable).

sect4.title: darktable.gui.action_images
sect4.para: A table of images on which the user expects us to act.
It is based on both the hovered image and the selection and is consistent with the way darktable works.
It is recommended to use this table to implement Lua actions rather than dt.gui.hovered or dt.gui.selected to be consistant with darktable's GUI.

sect4.title: darktable.gui.hovered
sect4.para: The image under the cursor or nil if no image is hovered.

sect4.title: darktable.gui.selection
sect4.para: Allows to change the set of selected images.

listitem.para: A table of images which will define the selected images. If this parameter is not given the selection will be untouched. If an empty table is given the selection will be emptied.
A table containing the selection as it was before the function was called.

sect3.title: darktable.tags
sect3.para: Allows access to all existing tags.

sect4.title: darktable.tags.#
sect4.para: Each existing tag has a numeric entry in the tags table - use ipairs to iterate over them.

sect4.title: darktable.tags.create
sect4.para: Creates a new tag and return it. If the tag exists return the existing tag.

listitem.para: The name of the new tag.

sect4.title: darktable.tags.find
sect4.para: Returns the tag object or nil if the tag doesn't exist.

listitem.para: The name of the tag to find.
The tag object or nil.

sect4.title: darktable.tags.delete
sect4.para: Deletes the tag object, detaching it from all images.

listitem.para: The tag to be deleted.

sect4.title: darktable.tags.attach
sect4.para: Attach a tag to an image; the order of the parameters can be reversed.

listitem.para: The tag to be attached.
The image to attach the tag to.

sect4.title: darktable.tags.detach
sect4.para: Detach a tag from an image; the order of the parameters can be reversed.

listitem.para: The tag to be detached.
The image to detach the tag from.

sect4.title: darktable.tags.get_tags
sect4.para: Gets all tags attached to an image.

listitem.para: The image to get the tags from.
A table of tags that are attached to the image.

sect3.title: darktable.configuration
sect3.para: This table regroups values that describe details of the configuration of darktable.

sect4.title: darktable.configuration.has_gui
sect4.para: True if darktable has a GUI (launched through the main darktable command, not darktable-cli).

sect4.title: darktable.configuration.verbose
sect4.para: True if the Lua logdomain is enabled.

sect4.title: darktable.configuration.tmp_dir
sect4.para: The name of the directory where darktable will store temporary files.

sect4.title: darktable.configuration.config_dir
sect4.para: The name of the directory where darktable will find its global configuration objects (modules).

sect4.title: darktable.configuration.cache_dir
sect4.para: The name of the directory where darktable will store its mipmaps.

sect3.title: darktable.preferences
sect3.para: Lua allows you do manipulate preferences. Lua has its own namespace for preferences and you can't access nor write normal darktable preferences.

Preference handling functions take a _script_ parameter. This is a string used to avoid name collision in preferences (i.e namespace). Set it to something unique, usually the name of the script handling the preference.
Preference handling functions can't guess the type of a parameter. You must pass the type of the preference you are handling. Allowed values are the following strings
* string
* bool
* integer

sect4.title: darktable.preferences.register
sect4.para: Creates a new preference entry in the Lua tab of the preference screen. If this function is not called the preference can't be set by the user (you can still read and write invisible preferences).

listitem.para: Invisible prefix to guarantee unicity of preferences.
A unique name used with the script part to identify the preference.
The type of the preference - one of the string values described above.
The label displayed in the preference screen.
The tooltip to display in the preference menue.
Default value to use when not set explicitely or by the user.
Minimum value (integer preferences only).
Maximum value (integer preferences only).

sect4.title: darktable.preferences.read
sect4.para: Reads a value from a Lua preference.

listitem.para: Invisible prefix to guarantee unicity of preferences.
The name of the preference displayed in the preference screen.
The type of the preference - one of the string values described above.
The value of the preference.

sect4.title: darktable.preferences.write
sect4.para: Writes a value to a Lua preference.

listitem.para: Invisible prefix to guarantee unicity of preferences.
The name of the preference displayed in the preference screen.
The type of the preference - one of the string values described above.
The value to set the preference to.

sect3.title: darktable.styles
sect3.para: This pseude table allows you to access and manipulate styles.

sect4.title: darktable.styles.#
sect4.para: Each existing style has a numeric index; you can iterate them using ipairs.

sect4.title: darktable.styles.create
sect4.para: Create a new style based on an image.

listitem.para: The image to create the style from.
The name to give to the new style.
The description of the new style.
The new style object.
the style to delete

sect4.title: darktable.styles.duplicate
sect4.para: Create a new style based on an existing style.

listitem.para: The style to base the new style on.
The new style's name.
The new style's description.
The new style object.

sect4.title: darktable.styles.apply
sect4.para: Apply a style to an image. The order of parameters can be inverted.

listitem.para: The style to use.
The image to apply the style to.

sect3.title: darktable.database
sect3.para: Allows to access the database of images. Note that duplicate images (images with the same RAW but different XMP) will appear multiple times with different duplicate indexes. Also note that all images are here. This table is not influenced by any GUI filtering (collections, stars etc...).

sect4.title: darktable.database.duplicate
sect4.para: Creates a duplicate of an image and returns it.

listitem.para: the image to duplicate
The created image if an image is imported or the toplevel film object if a film was imported.

sect4.title: darktable.database.import
sect4.para: Imports new images into the database.

listitem.para: The filename or directory to import images from.
NOTE: If the images are set to be imported recursively in preferences only the toplevel film is returned (the one whose path was given as a parameter).

NOTE2: If the parameter is a directory the call is non-blocking; the film object will not have the newly imported images yet. Use a post-import-film filtering on that film to react when images are actually imported.

sect3.title: darktable.modules
sect3.para: This table describe the different loadable modules of darktable.

sect4.title: darktable.modules.format
sect4.para: Functions to get parameter objects for the different export formats.

sect5.title: darktable.modules.format.png
sect5.para: Used to get a new png format object.

listitem.para: A new format object describing the parameters to export to png - initialised to the values contained in the GUI.

sect4.title: darktable.modules.storage
sect4.para: Functions to get parameter objects for the different export storages.
New values may appear in this table if new storages are registered using Lua.

sect5.title: darktable.modules.storage.email
sect5.para: Used to get a new email storage object.

listitem.para: A new storage object describing the parameters to export with - initialised to the values contained in the GUI.

sect3.title: darktable.debug
sect3.para: This section must be activated separately by calling
require "darktable.debug"

sect4.title: darktable.debug.dump
sect4.para: This will return a string describing everything Lua knows about an object, used to know what an object is.
This function is recursion-safe and can be used to dump _G if needed.

listitem.para: The object to dump.
A name to use for the object.
A string containing a text description of the object - can be very long.

sect4.title: darktable.debug.debug
sect4.para: Initialized to false; set it to true to also dump information about metatables.

sect4.title: darktable.debug.type
sect4.para: Similar to the system function type() but it will return the real type instead of "userdata" for darktable specific objects.

listitem.para: The object whos type must be reported.
A string describing the type of the object.

sect2.title: types
sect2.para: This section documents types that are specific to darktable's Lua API.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_email
sect3.para: TBSL, force first

sect3.title: types.dt_lua_image_t
sect3.para: Image objects represent an image in the database. This is slightly different from a file on disk since a file can have multiple developements.
Note that this is the real image object; changing the value of a field will immediately change it in darktable and will be reflected on any copy of that image object you may have kept.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.film
sect4.para: The film object that contains this image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.id
sect4.para: A unique id identifying the image in the database.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.path
sect4.para: The file the directory containing the image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.duplicate_index
sect4.para: If there are multiple images based on a same file, each will have a unique number, starting from 0.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.publisher
sect4.para: The publisher field of the image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.title
sect4.para: The title field of the image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.creator
sect4.para: The creator field of the image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.rights
sect4.para: The rights field of the image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.description
sect4.para: The description field for the image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_lens
sect4.para: The id string of the lens used.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_aperture
sect4.para: The aperture saved in the exif data.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_exposure
sect4.para: The exposure time of the image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_focal_length
sect4.para: The focal length of the image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_iso
sect4.para: The iso used on the image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.exif_datetime_taken
sect4.para: The date and time of the image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.latitude
sect4.para: GPS latitude data of the image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.longitude
sect4.para: GPS longitude data of the image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.is_raw
sect4.para: True if the image is a RAW file.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.is_ldr
sect4.para: True if the image is a ldr image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.is_hdr
sect4.para: True if the image is a hdr image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.rating
sect4.para: The rating of the image (-1 for rejected).

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.red
sect4.para: True if the image has the corresponding colorlabel.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.group_with
sect4.para: Puts the first image in the same group as the second image. If no second image is provided the image will be in its own group.

listitem.para: The image whose group must be changed.
The image we want to group with.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.make_group_leader
sect4.para: Makes the image the leader of its group.

listitem.para: The image we want as the leader.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_image_t.get_group_members
sect4.para: Returns a table containing all images of the group. The group leader is both at a numeric key and at the "leader" special key (so you probably want to use ipairs to iterate through that table).

listitem.para: The image whose group we are querying.
A table of image objects containing all images that are in the same group as the image.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format
sect3.para: A virtual type representing all format types.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format.plugin_name
sect4.para: A unique name for the plugin.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format.name
sect4.para: A human readable name for the plugin.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format.extension
sect4.para: The typical filename extension for that format.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format.mime
sect4.para: The mime type associated with the format.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format.max_width
sect4.para: The max width allowed for the format (0 = unlimited).

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format.max_height
sect4.para: The max height allowed for the format (0 = unlimited).

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format.write_image
sect4.para: Exports an image to a file. This is a blocking operation that will not return until the image is exported.

listitem.para: The format that will be used to export.
The image object to export.
The filename to export to.
Returns true on success.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_png
sect3.para: Type object describing parameters to export to png.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_png.bpp
sect4.para: The bpp parameter to use when exporting.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_tiff
sect3.para: Type object describing parameters to export to tiff.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_tiff.bpp
sect4.para: The bpp parameter to use when exporting.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_exr
sect3.para: Type object describing parameters to export to exr.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_copy
sect3.para: Type object describing parameters to export to copy.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_pfm
sect3.para: Type object describing parameters to export to pfm.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_jpeg
sect3.para: Type object describing parameters to export to jpeg.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_jpeg.quality
sect4.para: The quality to use at export time.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_ppm
sect3.para: Type object describing parameters to export to ppm.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_webp
sect3.para: Type object describing parameters to export to webp.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_webp.quality
sect4.para: The quality to use at export time.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_webp.comp_type
sect4.para: The overall quality to use; can be one of "webp_lossy" or "webp_lossless".

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_webp.hint
sect4.para: A hint on the overall content of the image, can be one of "hint_default", "hint_picture", "hint_photo", "hint_graphic".

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_j2k
sect3.para: Type object describing parameters to export to jpeg2000.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_j2k.quality
sect4.para: The quality to use at export time.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_j2k.bpp
sect4.para: The bpp parameter to use when exporting.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_j2k.format
sect4.para: The format to use can be one of "j2k" or "jp2".

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_format_data_j2k.preset
sect4.para: The preset to use can be one of "cinema2k_24", "cinema2k_48", "cinema4k_24".

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage
sect3.para: A virtual type representing all storage types.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage.plugin_name
sect4.para: A unique name for the plugin.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage.name
sect4.para: A human readable name for the plugin.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage.width
sect4.para: The currently selected width for the plugin.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage.height
sect4.para: The currently selected height for the plugin.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage.recommended_width
sect4.para: The recommended width for the plugin.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage.recommended_height
sect4.para: The recommended height for the plugin.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage.supports_format
sect4.para: Checks if a format is supported by this storage.

listitem.para: The storage type to check against.
The format type to check.
True if the format is supported by the storage.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_flickr
sect3.para: An object containing parameters to export to flickr.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_facebook
sect3.para: An object containing parameters to export to facebook.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_latex
sect3.para: An object containing parameters to export to latex.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_latex.title
sect4.para: The title to use for export.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_picasa
sect3.para: An object containing parameters to export to picasa.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_gallery
sect3.para: An object containing parameters to export to gallery.

sect4.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_gallery.title
sect4.para: The title to use for export.

sect3.title: types.dt_imageio_module_storage_data_disk
sect3.para: An object containing parameters to export to disk.

sect3.title: types.dt_lua_film_t
sect3.para: A film in darktable; this represents a directory containing imported images.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_film_t.id
sect4.para: A unique numeric id used by this film.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_film_t.path
sect4.para: The path represented by this film.

sect3.title: types.dt_style_t
sect3.para: A style that can be applied to an image.

sect4.title: types.dt_style_t.#
sect4.para: The different items that make the style.

sect3.title: types.dt_style_item_t
sect3.para: An element that is part of a style.

sect4.title: types.dt_style_item_t.name
sect4.para: The name of the style item.

sect4.title: types.dt_style_item_t.num
sect4.para: The position of the style item within its style.

sect3.title: types.dt_lua_tag_t
sect3.para: A tag that can be attached to an image.

sect4.title: types.dt_lua_tag_t.#
sect4.para: The images that have that tag attached to them.

sect2.title: events
sect2.para: This section documents events that can be used to trigger Lua callbacks.

sect3.title: events.intermediate-export-image
sect3.para: This event is called each time an image is exported, once for each image after the image has been processed to an image format but before the storage has moved the image to its final destination.

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The image object that has been exported.
The name of the file that is the result of the image being processed.

sect4.title: events.intermediate-export-image.extra_registration_parameters
sect4.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

sect3.title: events.post-import-image
sect3.para: This event is triggered whenever a new image is imported into the database.
This event can be registered multiple times, all callbacks will be called.

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The image object that has been exported.

sect4.title: events.post-import-image.extra_registration_parameters
sect4.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

sect3.title: events.shortcut
sect3.para: This event registers a new keyboad shortcut. The shortcut isn't bound to any key until the users does so in the preference panel.
The event is triggered whenever the shortcut is triggered.
This event can only be registered once per value of shortcut.

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The tooltip string that was given at registration time.
The string that will be displayed on the shortcut preference panel describing the shortcut.

sect3.title: events.post-import-film
sect3.para: This event is triggered when an film import is finished (all post-import-image callbacks have already been triggered). This event can be registered multiple times.

listitem.para: The name of the event that triggered the callback.
The new film that has been added. If multiple films were added recursively only the top level film is reported.

sect4.title: events.post-import-film.extra_registration_parameters
sect4.para: This event has no extra registration parameters.

sect2.title: attributes
sect2.para: This section documents various attributes used throughout the documentation.

sect3.title: attributes.write
sect3.para: This object is a variable that can be written to.

sect3.title: attributes.read
sect3.para: This object is a variable that can be read.

sect3.title: attributes.has_pairs
sect3.para: This object can be used as an argument to the system function "pairs" and iterated upon.

sect3.title: attributes.has_ipairs
sect3.para: This object can be used as an argument to the system function "ipairs" and iterated upon.

sect3.title: attributes.has_length
sect3.para: This object has a specific length function that will be used by the # operator.

sect3.title: attributes.has_tostring
sect3.para: This object has a specific reimplementation of the "tostring" method that allows pretty-printing it.

sect3.title: attributes.implicit_yield
sect3.para: This call will release the Lua lock while executing, thus allowing other Lua callbacks to run.

sect2.title: system
sect2.para: This section documents changes to system functions.

sect3.title: system.yield
sect3.para: Lua functions can yield at any point. The parameters and return types depend on why we want to yield.
A callback that is yielding allows other Lua code to run.
* wait_ms: one extra parameter; the execution will pause for that many miliseconds; yield returns nothing;
* file_readable: an opened file from a call to the OS library; will return when the file is readable; returns nothing;
* run_command: a command to be run by "sh -c"; will return when the command terminates; returns the return code of the execution.

listitem.para: The type of yield; can be one of "wait_ms", "file_readable", "run_command".
An extra parameter: integer for "wait_ms", open file for "file_readable", string for "run_command".
Nothing for "wait_ms" and "file_readable"; the returned code of the command for "run_command".
